Class Plug

    • Plug

  • public class Plug
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Bogdan

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Plug​(char inputEnd1, char inputEnd2)  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean classesWith​(Plug inputPlug)
      Checks if the Plugs inputPlug and the current object try to connect to a common socket.Each socket of a Plug is compared with each of the sockets of the other Plug.
      char encode​(char letterIn)
      Returns the encoded letter as char If letterIn represents a socket already connected to the Plug the other socket of the Plug is returned otherwise the original input letter is returned
      char getEnd1​()
      Returns the first socket of the Plug
      char getEnd2​()
      Returns the second socket of the Plug
      void setEnd1​(char newEnd1)
      Set the first socket of the Plug to the value of the parameter being passed
      void setEnd2​(char newEnd2)
      Set the second socket of the Plug to the value of the parameter being passed

    • Method Detail

      • classesWith

        public boolean classesWith​(Plug inputPlug)
        Checks if the Plugs inputPlug and the current object try to connect to a common socket.Each socket of a Plug is compared with each of the sockets of the other Plug.
        Parameters:
        inputPlug - the plug to be checked
        Returns:
        boolean TRUE if there is a common socket between the two Plugs FALSE otherwise

      • encode

        public char encode​(char letterIn)
        Returns the encoded letter as char If letterIn represents a socket already connected to the Plug the other socket of the Plug is returned otherwise the original input letter is returned
        Parameters:
        letterIn - the letter to be changed
        Returns:
        char the encoded letter

      • getEnd1

        public char getEnd1​()
        Returns the first socket of the Plug
        Returns:
        char the first socket of the Plug

      • getEnd2

        public char getEnd2​()
        Returns the second socket of the Plug
        Returns:
        char the second socket of the Plug

      • setEnd1

        public void setEnd1​(char newEnd1)
        Set the first socket of the Plug to the value of the parameter being passed
        Parameters:
        newEnd1 - the socket to be connected

      • setEnd2

        public void setEnd2​(char newEnd2)
        Set the second socket of the Plug to the value of the parameter being passed
        Parameters:
        newEnd2 - the socket to be connected
